column2: Marion, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have found it works very well. If I take 2 tablets when I eat beans I have no problem at all and they used to just tear me up. Also, I just had a gallbladder attack which left my whole digestive system messed up, anything I eat causes gas, and a Beano tablet with a meal helps a lot.

column2: LikesWebMD, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took Bean-o as directed to prevent gas several weeks ago. Thought it was all in my head when I felt sick to my stomach about an hour or so after taking it.  Took it again just today and had terrible stomach cramps, then began vomiting.  I will never take this medication again. The side effects are horrible.

column2: james, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: did not ease up my pain

column2: Dean_Gartner, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I'm never going to use Beano again. I started taking it a couple of weeks ago. It's been moderately effective for reducing gas. But I've been feeling poorly for two weeks and assumed I had a lingering case of flu. But after reading Beano side effect comments here - dizziness, fatigue, stool issues - I realize Beano must be the culprit, not flu. Additionally, I'm gluten intolerant and only today learned that Beano contains wheat, a major source of gluten! So no wonder I've been feeling so poorly. Beano has been absolutely terrible for me. I was worried I might be seriously sick. This product is terrible for many people and should include detailed warnings!!!

column2: lulu, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I will NEVER take this again, I have NEVER been so sick in my life!! Within an hour of taking this product, I was feeling uneasy. I tried to relax and put it off. Went out of town for the evening and stopped to get a bite to eat. Within 30 minutes I was violently vomiting and this is 24 hours later and it has not stopped yet!

column2: PrincessJen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is NOT good to take! I was taking it for several months and still had major gas. Also found out that it causes HYPOGLYCEMIA because it breaks down complex carbohydrates, which if you are an athlete like myself, is very BAD for you. I had to buy a glucose meter and started using it. I would eat 2 beano right before my meal, eat and check my blood sugar. It causes a veryfast, high spike when then results in a terrible drop. My blood sugar would drop below 60 within an hr of eating a high carb meal. Low blood sugar causes dizziness, confusion, fatigue, aggitation and coldness. It is a TERRIBLE feeling to have. I will NEVER take this again and I will BE reporting this to the FDA.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started taking it to control flatulence. It's been very effective. After 20+ years of frustration, embarrassment, etc., I seem to have found the cure. I'm a believer!

column2: Can You Hear Me Now?, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I will never take this product again. I took Beano twice for the same cause. To prevent gas and abdominal bloating when I drink a whole-fruit smoothie. The very first time I took it, I swallowed two tablets BEFORE MY FIRST BITE OF FOOD and six (6) hours later, I had pit-of-the stomach nausea that made me leave work early for fear of vomiting at my work station. Second time taking it, about three weeks later, I chewed two tablets in compliance with the directions (Swallow or Chew 2-3 tablets BEFORE YOUR FIRST BITE OF FOOD). I waited about twenty minutes before I drank my Odwalla Smoothie in Mango Tango. Approximately seven (7) hours later, I became severely nauseated and no mint would abate the thick saliva that formed in my mouth; also, chewing gum made it worse. So, I had to be excused from my customer and my trainer and hurried to the ladies room. In the ladies room, as I was washing my hands (due to touching money), before I could flee the sink and go into a stall, I began to vomit vehemently all over the sink and floor.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had success with this product when using it for before one meal.  When using it for an entire weekend, it stops gas AND bowel movements, which makes it worse than not using it at all.  For awhile I thought it was just coincidence, but it has happened enough times now to be pretty conclusive.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Works great for me I would feel instantly bloated after certain meals and gassy and Beano took it all away ..

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I tried it three times to be sure.  Side effects: bad abdominal pain, bloating & diarrhea.  I will never take again.

column2: PAW, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I have had success in treating gas, bloating and even a reduction in acid reflux. However, my uterine fibroid's started bleeding so badly I was ready to go to the ER. I have never had them bleed like this before, it was like water running out of me. This happened after about 2 weeks of using the product daily 3 times a day. The bleeding has lasted for 5-15 minutes once or twice a day for 3 days.  It may not be the product causing it but I have stopped taking it and the bleeding seems to have stopped for now. I will wait for a week or so and try the product again and see if the same thing occurs. I hope it doesn't, I really liked the benefits of the product. I hope the bleeding doesn't happen again.

column2: Yaya, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using Beano for a couple of months now and it does help me.  However, I already have a serious problem with constipation from other medicine I have been prescribed, and I'm not sure it is the Beano or not, but now not only am I constipated but am now experiencing impaction.

column2: marv, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have tried using three different times, didn't help with gas and bloating, but did make me feel like had a mild case of stomach flu.

column2: packerfan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Took Beano to prevent gas before I ate homemade chili.  Within an hour, had severe stomach cramps, sweating, nausea and diarrhea.  Stomach cramps and nausea lasted long into the night.  Will never use this again.

column2: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My husband is required to take beano before meals and gas-x after meals for Prostate Cancer radiation therapy.  We are 2 weeks in and he is having severe stomach "cramping", diarrhea and is vomiting after meals.  I'm so grateful that I've checked here because obviously, he is one who can not tolerate beano.  I have also checked on Gas-x.  I find no negative reviews.  I will take this information to the radiologist tomorrow.

column2: kim, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have used beano for years and i love it, when i was breast feeding i was giving my baby gas and i started taking beano if I was going to dark greens (broc, asparagus) for me and my family and neighbor it works wonderful.

column2: sharon, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Beano a few times but didn't put the side effects I went through to be from taking Beano. Although I had upper abdominal pain and acid stomach, I just thought it was from air bubbles and that Beano just wasn't working. But the other day I took it again right before eating my lunch (12 PM)and with in 1 1/2 hours I started getting upper abdominal pain. I thought again that Beano just doesn't work. But the pain kept getting stronger and by 7 pm that night I had sever upper abdominal pain. So sever I almost had my husband bring me to the hospital. The only thing that stopped me from going is embarrassment thinking they would send me home because of gas pain. Then I started vomiting my guts out, had diarrhea , gas pain, and blotting.  My upper abdomen was in such pain, I still cant believe I went through that! I mean I am still recovering from the pain I went through from taking that product. Please do not take it my inner chest is still painful from vomiting so much and my stomach muscles feel like someone beat me up inside.

column2: PeaceNQuiet, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just need to take one beano tablet either before or after I start eating veggies, fruits, anything with gluten, etc. to prevent gas. I started taking it for a timed 2-day exam, and it kept me peacefully and quietly seated for 12 hours! A life saver!

column2: Female  (Patient)
column9: I took Beano twice and I have been sick for a month with --ha ha-- gas, stomach cramping and the runs.  I have been on probiotics for three days now and I'm still sick.  I will never take it again.

column2: Nick@40, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I get gas every night and it was starting to get embarrassing. I started off just taking one Beano before my last meal of the day and it has worked for me. No more gas at night, no stomach pains and no other side effects noticed.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: Beano did prevent stomach and gas pains, but I took one in the evening and when I woke up at 5am to use the restroom I feel like I was sea sick and thought I may have vertigo.  I then assumed I had a inner ear infection but then one month later I took another beano to prevent gas pains and once again woke up and was feeling motion sick.  Took some motion sick medication to get me through the day.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Beano left me with severe stomach pain, gas and diarrhea.  I took it for three days to help with gas/bloating and I was getting worse.  I stopped taking it and it is still working through my system.  Will never take/buy it again!

column2: Bluegroove, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Works well for gas, but must be if the meal is very large or excessive, then it doesnt work as well. Also if there is already constipation, it seem to cause diarrea or gas because its trying to move through that blockage!(but that stuff needs to come out anyway - so bonus..) Works for me as long as I am not overeating. 2 with lunch, 3 with dinner.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: I only take one with my meal and it works fine. I have'nt had any problem yet. I started taking them a month age,they work better I think if you just take one with a meal maybe twice aday.

column2: Glenn, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It seems as though I get bloated from many foods, so I take two Beanos with about everything I consume, but I find it of little help.

column2: SickBoy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My boyfriend took Beano before dinner tonight. He started complaining about his stomach a little while after. About half an hour ago he said he got a terrible rush of dizziness and has been in the bathroom vomiting horribly since then.

column2: Gasless in Seattle, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Used Beano two completely different times before eating chili.  Did not experience gas, but both times, had to get to bathroom fast, after eating.  Left me feeling a little nauseous and afraid to get far from the bathroom.

column2: Starlght3, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I get gas very very easily.  I take 2 beano before each meal and it seems to work great.  Now my only concern is that my stool has become very dark & heavy.  Not sure if this is a side-effect from this product or not.

column2: oldbuzzard, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Many foods give me serious gas.  My employees don't want to come in my office!BEANO WORKS FOR ME!!  For me it is MUCH MORE effective if I take ONE with food, one thirty minutes later, and with certain foods a third even later.  Taking two or three at once wasn't very effective.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Thought this was supposed to help eliminate gas!  I've never been so uncomfortable with bloating and diarrhea! Took 2 tablets for the first time today, haven't make any changes to my diet, and Im in pain! The gurgling in my stomach is intense and annoying! I do not recommend this product, but if you do plan on trying it, make sure you dont have any important plans for the day!

column2: Kat, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I use it to cook beans and it really takes the "gas effect" out of them. Very pleased with the results.

column2: Mom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have found that Beano works for me sometimes, but not as consistently as I would like.  I have had some random abdominal pains since using it regularly and I wonder if it's related.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken Beano twice as directed and both times began projectile vomiting and diarrhea about 2 hours after eating. The only common thing in each event was the Beano. The events continued until I was totally cleaned out ... about 1.5 hours.

column2: darek, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column9: Does absolutely nothing. What a rip-off. I take three before every meal and my stomach is growling like a grizzly bear anyway. Complete hoax.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
